events.title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
events.description: Apollo 11 astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin landed on the Moon, and Armstrong became the first human to walk on the lunar surface.
events.significance: Marked humanity's first successful manned mission to another celestial body, a major milestone in space exploration.

events.title: Failed Assassination Attempt on Adolf Hitler (July 20 Plot)
events.description: A group of German officers attempted to assassinate Adolf Hitler with a bomb in an effort to overthrow the Nazi regime.
events.significance: Demonstrated internal opposition to Hitler within Germany and had lasting impacts on resistance movements during the war.

events.title: Battle of Bouvines
events.description: King Philip II of France defeated an English coalition led by King John and Emperor Otto IV, solidifying French royal power.
events.significance: Established French dominance in the region and contributed to the decline of English territories in France.

events.title: First Polio Vaccine Tested
events.description: Dr. Hilary Koprowski administered the first effective oral poliovirus vaccine to a child in a clinical test.
events.significance: Paved the way for widespread polio immunization and eventual near-eradication of the disease.

events.title: Great Fire of Chicago Ends
events.description: After several days, the Great Chicago Fire was finally contained, having destroyed much of the city.
events.significance: Led to major urban rebuilding, modernization, and improved fire safety standards.
